text:
Draft at the Brewpub - Maple Shade. 
Clear golden color with a white head that coats the glass in lace. Grassy and a little herbal. Clean pale malt up front. Bright hop finish. Lively and fairly clean. Solid, but not better than that, example.
Clear brassy gold with Lacy white head aroma is mild grain flava is rich grain with a nice bitter bite feels light to medium with decent fizz finishes dry moderately bitter

Draft at Maple Shade. Poured a good looking solid gold with a fluffy white head. Aroma of dry grains, white grapes, cereal. Flavor is lightly sweet, corn, grain husk, medium honey topped dough. Solid mouthfeel with strong carbonation.
on tap at Maple Shade - slightly sweet aroma and flavor. Nice golden color. Pretty good.

Draught in the Phoenixville location: This one poured a clear golden color with a small white head on it. It left some lacing. It had a milder aroma, but it was still good. Somewhat grassy and earthy with some malts tossed in. The taste is a hair dry. Touch of sweetness to it. Earthy notes with some malts. Nice and refreshing.

On tap at th3 lancaster pub. Looks like pale lager. Nice clean fresh aroma, very attractive to the olfactory.  Thin head. Yes, does not have an overthe top bitter attack like so many pilsner wannah bees. Freah easy and fun. Goes down easy, one of the more enjoyable beers at iron hill lancaster. Easily a lager lovers friend. Slight fruity backbone., Good overall beer drinking experience.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Had this several times at Phoenixville location.  Pours hazy straw colored with nose of noble hops, acidic malt, tart fruit.  Tastes tart, hoppy, citric, with a crisp and tart finish.  A solid BP.
Grassy lemon nose with just a touch of green apple. Taste is fairly dry, some nice cracker malt, a touch of honey, lots of grass and lemon.

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2015 Draught in Newark.  Pale golden pour, good strong bitterness, diesel aromatics of grass and flowers, soft-bodied and smooth, a touch too sweet but still worthy of ten pints. [2011.05.09: 3.8]
Tap in Maple Shade.  Clear, rich golden with a creamy beige head and lace.  Has some sickly sweetness on the finish and after, need to dry this out a bit, tastes vaguely of caramel toothpaste.  Fizzly and seemingly crystal-heavy, light-medium body  would be a great step-up for the Sam Adams drinker.  [3.2]  Drinks much better by the pint than by the sampler [2015.10.29: 3.4].

On draft at the Newark location. Full golden to straw color, nice carbonation bubbles on steady rise/display. The aroma was grainy, cereal, bready, grassy, sweet. The flavor followed, too much malty sweetness for a pilsner, but enjoyable. There were fruity berry type notes in this too, not quite as clean as desirable. Mouthfeel was full body with good carbonation, slightly sticky afterwards.

Growler at Shenandoah Throwdown 2010.  Pours a nice clear deep golden with a long lasting fluffy sticky white head.  Aroma is fresh big saaz hoppiness, greenl grassy light spicy, sappy light pin  and slight fruity hints over big full biscuity and bready pils malts, very fresh.  Flavor is more toast, biscuit, pils malt, bready, almost a green melon with spicy saaz hops, sweet bread and carapils with a clean snappy bracing bitter finsih.  Nice!
on tap.  nice golden yellow pilsner.  hops but not to bitter.  crisp and refreshing.  a little light but true to style.  well made.
From a growler shared by Dickinsonbeer. Thanks Paul.  Poured golden orange with a small white head.  Pretty hoppy, citrus, bread.  Nice dry finish.  Very good.

Served on draft at the brewpub. Pours a clear golden color with a medium head. Good head retention and lacing. Aroma of bready malts, caramel and light fruity notes. The taste is fruity with notes of berry and a light bitterness. Medium bodied.

Shenandoah Throwdown, growler, thanks Dickinsonbeer.  Crystal clear apple juice body topped by medium white head.  Aroma is medium sweet, apple, bread, spicy.  Taste is medium sweet, spicy, grass, some bread, grapefruit.  Light body, some crispness, acidity.

Growler at the Shenandoah Throwdown.  Pours a clear gold with a thin white head.  Tropical fruit, soft caramel.  Slightly plastic and vinyl flavors, nice wheat component though.  Nice and easy drinking.

Shenandoah throwdown.  Thanks to dickinsonbeer.  Clear straw-yellow pour with a fluffy white head.  Good lacing the glass.  Lots of cereal on the nose.  Sweet malt with a bit of apple.  Lots of grassy hops.  Dry grassy hops dominate the flavor.  Cereal malts with a bit of fruit.  Very hoppy and dry.

June 2010 Release On Draft at Iron Hill Lancaster, PA.  Extremely well done Pilsner.  Nice citrus Hop aroma and flavor - not quite as bitter as Victorys Prima Pils, but definitely up there in the flavor department.  Delicious summer beer - much better than expected.
